D1.label: Energy Transition Winner — Sustainability Revenue Grows to 60%+
D1.description: Energy Transition Winner — Sustainability Revenue Grows to 60%+
D1.plain_english: Worley is positioning as the go-to engineering partner for the energy transition with sustainability revenue growing rapidly.
D1.what_to_watch: Sustainability revenue mix, new contract wins in hydrogen/CCS/offshore wind, IRA and EU Green Deal funding.
D1.upside: Material re-rating if sustainability revenue exceeds 60% and margins converge with traditional energy.
D1.risk_plain: If project delays persist and sustainability margins remain structurally lower, growth thesis weakens.

D2.label: Traditional Energy Cash Cow — LNG and Upstream Sustain
D2.description: Traditional Energy Cash Cow — LNG and Upstream Sustain
D2.plain_english: Traditional energy still generates ~50% of revenue at higher margins, providing the cash flow foundation.
D2.what_to_watch: LNG investment cycle, Middle East upstream capex, oil price trajectory.
D2.upside: If traditional energy spending sustains, segment provides stable cash flow and higher margins.
D2.risk_plain: If oil prices collapse below US$60/bbl, traditional energy capex would be cut sharply.

D3.label: Margin Pressure — Integration Drag and Fixed-Price Exposure
D3.description: Margin Pressure — Integration Drag and Fixed-Price Exposure
D3.plain_english: EBITA margin remains below the 8-9% target due to legacy fixed-price contracts and lower sustainability margins.
D3.what_to_watch: Quarterly EBITA margin, fixed-price contract run-off, sustainability vs traditional margin gap.
D3.risk_plain: If margins cannot reach 8%+ by FY26, the market will question management execution credibility.

D4.label: Cyclical Downturn — Energy Capex Correction
D4.plain_english: A global recession triggers simultaneous cuts in both traditional and sustainability energy capex.
D4.what_to_watch: Global recession indicators, oil price, government clean energy subsidy policies, backlog cancellations.
D4.risk_plain: In past downturns revenue fell 20-30% and margins compressed to near-zero; elevated leverage amplifies risk.

big_picture: FY24 (June year-end) delivered revenue of $10.2B (up 8%), underlying EBITA of $720M (up 12%), and a record backlog of $16.8B. The sustainability revenue mix reached 49% (vs 36% in FY22), confirming the structural shift. However, EBITA margin of 7.1% remains below the 8-9% target, dragged by legacy fixed-price contracts and integration costs. Net debt of $2.1B (2.9x EBITDA) is elevated but declining. The stock has sold off 35% on concerns about margin trajectory and project delays in hydrogen/CCS segments. At current levels, the market is pricing in execution failure rather than the structural growth opportunity the backlog implies.
